title: Comparative Instructional Design of Music Reading Learning Interfaces Based on Cognitive Load Theory [K-12]

context.prior_knowledge: Basic music theory and instrumental performance experience (optional)
context.additional_context: Music literacy training for mathematics majors to improve abstract pattern recognition through interdisciplinary learning

learning_goals: Learners can explain differences in cognitive load across difficulty levels between two types of music-reading interfaces (instrument/software).
Learners can select the optimal interface based on their prior music knowledge level.
Learners can analyze cognitive load occurring during music notation interpretation across three dimensions (intrinsic/extraneous/germane).
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
